<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Commutes the operands in the given instruction by changing the operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// order and/or changing the instruction&#39;s opcode and/or the immediate value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The arguments &#39;CommuteOpIdx1&#39; and &#39;CommuteOpIdx2&#39; specify the operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to be commuted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Do not call this method for a non-commutable instruction or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// non-commutable operands.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Even though the instruction is commutable, the method may still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// fail to commute the operands, null pointer is returned in such cases.</span></CodeLine>
